website_summaries.verdict: This float is super bright and buoyant, but its weak point is at the connector. Many recommend buying it but replacing the connector upon arrival.
pros: Attaches to most waterproof point-and-shoot cameras
Brightly colored so it's easy to find in the water
Soft, smooth band material doesn't irritate the skin
cons: Clip connecting camera to strap can come undone suddenly

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical to buy this because I have a pretty heavy duty underwater camera. I was very pleasantly surprised at how well it keeps my sturdy Canon underwater camera afloat! I would highly recommend purchasing this!
customer_reviews.author: NKOTB_amante

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: Having just purchased a decent underwater camera, I wanted something that would keep the camera from dropping down 30 feet while I was snorkeling. The yellow wrist strap was comfortable on my wrist, dried quickly, and did keep the camera near the surface when I did let it float away from me in a pool. I have a Fuji underwater camera about the same size as a Canon Elf camera. Camera dropped down in the water but the top of the wrist strap was visible on the water surface. I don't know how one of the larger,heavier SLR underwater cameras would do, but I now have no fear about losing my new camera.
customer_reviews.author: M. Macleod

customer_reviews.title: Worked OK for my Panasonic Lumix TS4
customer_reviews.text: I bought this float for Panasonic Lumix TS4. Initial thoughts on the float were very high. It seemed well constructed and when I dropped the camera in the pool, it did float. On our third outing using this float, the string that connects the float to the camera snapped. Fortunately we noticed this when we were out of the water and didn't lose the camera. The float itself is very strong and well built, but the string is very low quality. I will most likely purchase this item again, but will keep the original wrist strap on the camera as well and loop it around the float for extra support.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Nothing worse than buying an expensive waterproof camera then watching it sink to the bottom. This float will ensure that does not happen. It will keep any point and shoot camera on the surface and provide a visible sign of where it is. Even if the camera can float, they do not float buy much and become very hard to see on the surface of the water. This float sits above the surface and is bright yellow. We took this rafting last year and when my wife and son were tossed along with the camera, we were able to easily retrieve the camera. The wife and son were another story, wish I had chums on them :-)
customer_reviews.author: A. Mefford

customer_reviews.title: Slows the sinking but doesn't actually float
customer_reviews.text: It will slow the sinking but not totally prevent it. Chunky. The string could be longer. I use this when kayaking and need to modify this so that the string is long enough to connect to the center of my paddle, allowing the camera to rest in my lap. As it is, I keep the camera in the pocket of my life vest with the chunky flotation wrist part dangling out of my jacket. It's too bulky to actually keep this around my wrist, but it is better than nothing. My small point and shoot will sink with this on, but it will slowly sink, so I have time to retrieve it.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Osborn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent float, so so strap
customer_reviews.text: This camera strap works as advertised. The float is comfortable to wear and it prevents the camera from sinking. I would say that there are 2 flaws to this product though. The strap that actually connects to the camera is ultra thin. Too thin. And the stitching that connects the thin strap to the float is quite poor. To counter this, I re-connected the strap that came with my camera. I then looped this through the float in a way that it holds onto the float without worrying about stitches or flimsy straps. I then discarded the flimsy strap. I would recommend this product for the float alone.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Hull

customer_reviews.title: Camera Float
customer_reviews.text: Very good product ... got to test it during my sea dive last May 31st both at the surface and about 11 meters down. Let the camera go and it starts to float upwards. Great yellow color (suggest adding some neon colors to product line) for visibility underwater and for surface retrieval. Every small underwater camera (or any small gadget you do not want to sink) should have one. One improvement I would recommend to the manufacturer - improve the lanyard connector locking mechanism & material both in the twist-off "locking design" and material "hefty-ness", because it could give way if snagged against dive gear. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: DT

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Keeps my camera a float and easy to spot. I was kayaking in Puget Sound sticking the camera under water to video the sea lions that were swimming around me. Then some ******* came speeding by and ended up tipping me over and I lost the camera for about 2 min but then I saw the beautiful yellow strap on a wave! Of-course I might have an anger issues because I got back in my kayak with my camera and caught back up with the guy 10 minutes later who was trying to fish. I made sure I made a lot of splashing to scare any fish away and exchanged choice words with the moron.
customer_reviews.author: Fissure

customer_reviews.title: Pentax WG-1 GPS camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera float works perfect with my Pentax WG-1 GPS camera. Pentax says camera with better & memory card weighs 5.9 ouces. I tried in a pool before we went snorkeling. In pool camera also had a web type strap with a caribiner clip making it even heavier. Float still floated camera at the surface. With caribiner cip off camera weighed less so i knew there would be no problems. Plus there is a release clip. Strap can stay on camera and yellow float can be taken off for cleaning/drying or for when camera isn't used in water. Works perfect and looks alot better than the Pentax float thats about 4X wider. or other floats.
customer_reviews.author: mrovationguitar

customer_reviews.title: Works Dandy, snaps from camera, wraps around camera to fit in case
customer_reviews.text: Be sure to buy before going to the Caribbean Islands. I got to Montegro Bay Jamaica and thought I had left this guy behind. I looked all over that city and could not find a shop that sold them. Then found it tucked inside a zipper pouch. I was afraid to use the new underwater camera without it. Bright color makes it easy to spot and then discovered that it will wrap around the camera and slide into a small case. It provides protection for the camera when not floating it in the water.Of course the unlock from the camera lanyard cord is a get feature and quite necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Carol A. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent float
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent float that doubles as a wrist strap. I originally got it to see if it could keep my GoPro Hero2 a float. I can say that I tested it in a swimming pool and it was able to keep the GoPro2 a float with the dive housing and I had attached a red filter from Backscatter.. You should be cautious about the strap, its not the thickest or strongest of cord. It would definitely snap if you were twirling it around, but it should hold on fine in like ocean waves. I was able to easily replace the portion of the cord that connects to the camera with stronger rope.
customer_reviews.author: V Ansae

customer_reviews.title: It works, but hoping for a thinner material in the next iteration
customer_reviews.text: Does its purpose and eliminates the anxiety of accidentally losing your camera to the deep floor of the ocean while snorkeling. For the next iteration though, perhaps Chums can try another material that has the same buoyancy but smaller. The bulk of the current strap is a problem to some camera bags (when attached) and also intrudes in some of the takes, especially if youre in a hurry to swim and capture a moment with that elusive jackfish or tortoise that you're searching for the whole afternoon.
customer_reviews.author: Judge J Drhedd

customer_reviews.title: Nice Float, detachable feature is handy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with my new Panasonicwaterproof camera. The float works great and is comfortable when shooting pictures. The float also detaches from the strap very easily for the times you don't need it. I attached the standard strap that comes with the camera to the strap of the CHUMS float so I'd always have a strap attached to the camera. That works great. You can't beat this for the price. It's more than bouyant enough to keep the camera afloat, and its bright yellow for easy visibility.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Ferraro

customer_reviews.title: Works with Nikon AW100
customer_reviews.text: I used this on a trip to Hawaii with my Nikon AW100. And it worked. The bright color makes it easy to stop. It's a little big but this helps out when you're trying to hold on to your camera snorkeling and swallowing gallons of the saltiest water that's ever burned your nostrils and throat because the $7 scuba mask set apparently likes to leak everywhere and because it's "illegal" to step on the coral that's 1 foot below you, preventing you from treading water and forcing you to move your body randomly until you reach a safe area.
customer_reviews.author: KZB

customer_reviews.title: Works great with the GoPro
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this float with a GoPro Hero 3. I took it to the lake with me and it worked great. The camera will float perfectly and the yellow color makes it easy to spot. I was sharing the camera with my friends and I was comfortable throwing it to them without worrying about it falling into the water, since it just surfaces immediately. I have large hands, but I can fit the float on easily. In some situations, this could be a problem, since it could probably slip off if you're doing more rigorous activities. But unless you're going down the rapids, this float is going to work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Skertchly

customer_reviews.title: Absolute necessity for waterproof cameras
customer_reviews.text: If you're bringing a camera (waterproof) to the beach, river, or wherever you'll be near water, having a float is a must. You can wear it around your wrist, but it keeps the camera afloat if you happen to drop it. Used it on our trip to the Galapagos, and was so glad to have it. While deep sea snorkeling, my sister and I would pass the camera back and forth to take pictures of the other and of the marine life, and there were several occasions where we missed; without the chums float, it probably would've sank to the bottom. (Used with Canon waterproof camera)
customer_reviews.author: estates

customer_reviews.title: Does not look exactly as pictured.
customer_reviews.text: Of course, I know that camera does not come with the float as pictured. What I meant by it does not look exactly as pictured is that the float on the picture looks brighter that what it is. The picture also looks like it is a good quality foam. What I got is a float that has a dull yellow color fabric. It would not hold on top of the water if you have a heavier camera. Tried this on Lumix inside a case and it could not hold the weight. I was able to hold the weight of a regular underwater point and shoot camera though.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: cool little float
customer_reviews.text: Just as mentioned it will hold typical water digital camera (upto 7.6oz). It floated just as expected, fits over wrist well and not too bulky. the float can be taken off, however only if there was another wrist strap (not the float kind but for normal use) that can fit in during a normal day to day operation. It would look silly to take this strap around, so novel idea to take if off by twisting the connection but fell short by not having another to plug in place of the float. So I will have take this strap off and replace with factory strap when in normal usage.
customer_reviews.author: P. Kim

customer_reviews.title: Nice wrist strap, but the cord can come off
customer_reviews.text: I got this to attach to an underwater camera while snorkeling. The wrist strap was fine and I didn't feel like it would slide off on my small wrists. Be careful when you attach it to a camera though. There is a plastic clip between the cord and the wrist strap that is probably meant to make it easy to detach the wrist strap when you don't need it. But, it's pretty flimsy and came off very easily (fortunately not when we were in the water!). My husband had to tie the cord directly to the wrist strap and the camera in several knots so we didn't have to worry about the plastic clip coming off.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: Works with the Nikon CoolPix AW100!
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and product information on this product and could not find anything about the Nikon CoolPix AW100. But I decided to try it anyway. Well, I'm delighted to report that it does float the Nikon AW100 complete with battery and SD card. It is a nice, minimalist, wrist float compared to others and I'm taking it to the Galapagos Islands next month with confidence, as this little Chums will keep my Nikon bobbing on the surface should I lose it in the water.
customer_reviews.author: CWTrooper

customer_reviews.title: but it seems sturdy to me
customer_reviews.text: I used it kayaking and swimming in the ocean. It stayed attached even when the water was a little rough. I haven't used it any more than that yet, but it seems sturdy to me. Some people find it breaks easy, but in my opinion, this float is for shallow photos. If you are diving or going even a bit deep, then you should have another device that just goes around your neck and does not have pressure on it to float to the surface. I found it to be sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: shopper519

customer_reviews.title: Just ok, but....
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my scuba camera - Reef-master. It works fine but I found I did not use it much as It's tricky to change it from one hand to the other under water and just found it easier to not have it on. I will say that it was great for kids who were using the camera while snorkelling, certainly gave me peace of mind that my camera would not be dropped. Its really only useful as a feather as I'm not confident the float would actually bring my smaller sized camera to the surface if dropped.
customer_reviews.author: Frozen North

customer_reviews.title: Works Nice
customer_reviews.text: Bought this float to go with the Sony TX-20. The product fits my wrist comfortably and worked well while snorkeling in the ocean. After reading other reviews I did attach the camera strap that came with the camera to the float so that if the snap happened to pop open I still had the camera attached. It never offered to pop off during my time in the water and I left the strap for the float attached to my camera and just unhooked it at the snap. The snap part is attached to my camera wrist strap and it doesn't get in the way of normal wear. I am very pleased with the float.
customer_reviews.author: bullette22

customer_reviews.title: How can you not have this?
customer_reviews.text: I use this in combination with my housing case for my camera every time I plan on taking underwater pictures. I brought this with me on my snorkeling trip in the Bahamas and it kept my camera afloat. I feel at ease knowing that my camera won't sink to the bottom of the ocean if the band slips off my wrist and I like how it is bright yellow for convenient search if it somehow floats away from you. Props to the maker.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my camera afloat
customer_reviews.text: I was pretty skeptical after reading reviews of people losing their cameras in the water because of weight or the strap breaking. I used this on a Canon Powershot D20 underwater camera. The camera is pretty solid and has some weight on it, but the float kept my camera from sinking. As a precaution, I did double loop the strap that came with my camera around the actual float to prevent loss due to a broken string. The string is a bit more flimsy than I was comfortable with, but rigging it up with way i did, did not cause much inconvenience. Better safe, than sorry. Overall, I would recommend this float as long as you double up the strap.
customer_reviews.author: Dorice Isaac

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Items works just as intended. My son bought a waterproof Kodak camera and bought this strap to go with it. We tested it out by tossing the camera and strap into our pool, and it keeps the camera right at the top of the water. Yes, the strap is large and pretty cumbersome and you will need to take it off to put your camera in your pocket, but it does the job well, and is bright and easy to see. Water does get into the strap a bit and you might want to ring it out before putting it somewhere you don't want to get wet, just as an FYI.
customer_reviews.author: Skye

customer_reviews.title: Good idea to have one of these!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Chums float for my new underwater camera and I'm glad I got it. It gave me the peace of mind to know that my camera will not come off my arm and it was very secure to the camera as well. Most of the time I was in fairly calm waters, but even in some turbulent tides, this worked great and stayed secure on my arm. If you are going to purchase an underwater camera, it's a good idea to get this product to make sure you come back home with your camera. At least I think so. It served me very well and I expect it to continue to do so on future trips.
customer_reviews.author: Packer Girl 32

customer_reviews.title: Keeps your stuff floating.
customer_reviews.text: It does what it's intended to do! It kept my waterproof camera floating like it says. The hardest part is remembering to attach the darn thing, because it's a little bit bulky. I don't want to carry this on the camera all the time, especially when I'm not around any sort of deep water at all where I could lose the camera. Item shipped fast, it was greatly appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Brett L.

customer_reviews.title: Need feedback after my granddaughter returns from trip
customer_reviews.text: We bought my granddaughter a not to expensive new underwater camera, the waterproof chum was to help her keep it handy when she is on a trip with her parents or with friends. I did see her snapping pictures at our Christmas Holiday party, and she had the camera hanging from her wrist. My granddaughter has been taking pictures for a couple of years, and does an excellent job. The Chum was shipped promptlyand received within time promised. The chum was also received in good condition.
customer_reviews.author: Ms Independent's husband

customer_reviews.title: great for snorkeling use
customer_reviews.text: I added this to a Canon D20, which doesn't float by itself. The camera's listed weight is just over the listed rating for the wristband, but in fact it works fine - in a pool test, half the float sits out of the water, indicating good reserve flotation capacity. I left the camera's original wriststrap on as well, because that has a tightening adjustment that the Chums doesn't have, but after using it on a snorkeling trip this seems redundant.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase it really works.
customer_reviews.text: Great it does what it says. I took to pools, beach and ocean and it had attached heavy items like underwater cellphone camera case with an iPhone rig. I was compleatly impressed with this purchase. It is a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: K LO QUE

customer_reviews.title: I had one of those nylon-ish float that looks like connected squares and it was good too
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit hesitant about the string part that connects to the camera being so thin, but after surviving the Caribbean and Pacific Oceans, hanging off of my life jacket while kayaking, and being thrown across the beach by the float itself- it never broke or snapped. Impressive. In the past, I had one of those nylon-ish float that looks like connected squares and it was good too, a slight lighter in weight; however, I have small wrists and my boyfriend has what I consider large wrists (he's 6'2" and probably around 180 lbs) and the Chums Float fits us our wrists much better, is more comfortable, and doesn't float/slip off like the other one.
customer_reviews.author: Lacie

customer_reviews.title: This one is a keeper
customer_reviews.text: I bought this float for my Panasonic underwater camera, which I gave 1 star..... BUT this is great. Unlike camera this is surely 5 star product for our use. We are not serious diver, just snorkel around. It floats Panasonic Lumix TS20 without any problem. Just make sure you DRY as often as you can. I even spray waterproof to prevent SOAK. It is very comfortable to use around your wrist and able to swim with it. I love the fact I can detach when I do not need.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine State

customer_reviews.title: Does what it should
customer_reviews.text: I used this with a waterproof case for my iphone and it worked like a charm. I was out snorkeling and not only was it securely around my wrist the whole time, but when I've been in pools with my phone in it's waterproof case and Chums wrist strap I can just let it go and it will float. This allows people to just pick up my phone and take photos of what's going on. It's like a new take on disposable cameras around the tables. Of course this free for all idea is only done around friends/family people I trust with my stuff. Not in a public setting. ;-)
customer_reviews.author: K.Dub

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of Boyancy Floaty Power
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to attach to a GoPro with suction mount that was going to be attached to a hull of a boat. I did a test in a tub and it worked great holding the camera, housing, arm mount and suction mount attachments above stagnant water at least. I never did get to test it with some waves on the lake as the camera never detached (luckily) but if it did detach I wouldn't have doubted I would have been able to find it.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Chums saved the day!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use with a water resistant camera during a white water canoeing trip and I was happy I did. We actually lost the camera going through a rocky section of the river and then we ended up finding it a few miles downstream when we saw an obnoxiously yellow object bobbing around in a natural pool. Thanks to Chums we got our camera back and all of our amazing pictures!
customer_reviews.author: S Salt

customer_reviews.title: better then the orange nylon looking ones
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 3 different camera floats. The Chums and two different version of the orange ones. This by far is my favorite. It fits around my wrist. The others don't adjust small enough and I have big wrists (maybe they are support to hang around you neck - that not sure that would work either. Anyhow I used this one while I snorkeled in water that was not calm (yellow flag on the Ocean) and had no problem with it coming off my wrist - unless I wanted it to. I did try and my Panasonic ts20 floats with the chums float.
customer_reviews.author: lava

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: This has worked well with my Nikon adventure camera. I also use it with my GoPro juuuuuust in case one of the mounts fails. It has lasted numerous trips to the river, lake, and ocean. One of the seems is splitting now, but I've had it for several years and I believe that's acceptable given the torture it has been subjected to.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bizzle

customer_reviews.title: I love this item
customer_reviews.text: I love this item! We bought one to use with a waterproof camera on our honeymoon. A recent trip to Florida prompted us to buy another one... we have waterproof cases for our iPhones (6s), these are buoyant enough to keep the phones afloat. My opinion, a must have for water people!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberley A

customer_reviews.title: Worked great on my Panasonic TS20 waterproof camera....
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you check the specified weight of your camera to make sure this thing can float it and your good to go! It can float cameras under 7 ounces. Easily floated our DMC-TS20 with plenty of bouyancy to spare. Worked perfectly to float our Panasonic DMC-TS20 waterproof camera while jumping waves in the ocean and floating around the pool. Bright yellow was nice so you could see it easily in the surf. Glad we bought it. It worked great.
customer_reviews.author: R. Getler

customer_reviews.title: good depending on how you plan to use it.
customer_reviews.text: I took it on a scuba trip so I wouldn't lose my camera, but when you down deeper under the water it makes the camera float up to the surface. When I finally resurfaced, I couldn't find my camera. So in my case it wasn't the best device. I really need something that would make the camera neither sink nor float to the top for scuba. For now I will just stick to using a longer strap and keeping it hooked to my vest or wrist that way.
customer_reviews.author: myAmazon

customer_reviews.title: You'll never lose your camera to the Deep
customer_reviews.text: I've used this with my Nikon AW100 to take thousands of picture underwater off the coast of Southern Mexico. There was a time that I put it in the pocket of my swim shorts and it came out. It was very easy to find it. The bright yellow handle is easy to spot. Every trip to Mexico I hear about someone losing their camera when they could have easily prevented it. If you take any underwater pics with a small digital camera this is a must add on.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: $600 worth of GoPro+Gear lost to the ocean deep
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I were so excited to go scuba diving and do watersports with our new GoPro on our honeymoon cruise in Tahiti. We used the Chums waterproof strap. One day, as my husband and I finished up our first session of stand-up paddleboarding, we transitioned to lounging on the floating pads tethered to the back of the cruise ship. With the GoPro attached to the Chums strap that was around his wrist, my husband attempted to pull himself out of the water and onto the pad. Immediately the black strap snapped and our GoPro sank to unknown depths. He was devastated, as we had just purchased this camera for this trip.
customer_reviews.author: Stella C.

customer_reviews.title: Loved this case.
customer_reviews.text: After I saw the pictures I left my other camera at home and just carried my phone. Was a little leary to take my phone in the water. After all it has my whole world on it and I would be out of luck with out a phone on vacation. But I did and it was great. no fogging, no over heating. You do have to leave the phone on while diving so it uses battery but I bought a remote charger and charged between dives.
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: Great idea. A bit bulky?
customer_reviews.text: It's a great idea but it's kind of bulky. I don't know if it works because I haven't dropped my camera in the water...It's to wear around your wrist and works that way. I like having it so I can have something to hopefully save my camera if I drop it in the lake!
customer_reviews.author: kshusker

customer_reviews.title: Great camera float  for several reason
customer_reviews.text: This camera float works so much better than expected. I purchased it to use with our Panasonic DMC-TS5. The bright yellow color makes it visible in all sorts of water conditions. The material is comfortable on your wrist and even dries quickly. I had a previous more bulky float and this Chums Float is superior in every way.
customer_reviews.author: M. thixton

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Floating Device! Note it does have a quick release
customer_reviews.text: Great device! It kept my Watershot Under Water camera afloat. However, it does have a quick release button that somehow came undone when I accidentally fell into the water and my camera quickly was falling. Did get to save my camera, and I tested the quick release plenty of times before and after and didn't seem to have a problem. It may have just been my hand slipped when I fell.
customer_reviews.author: GL

customer_reviews.title: Did the Job
customer_reviews.text: I have small 6" wrists & the wrist opening was quite a bit larger than I needed & kind of bulky, however it stayed on my wrist after hours of snorkeling & kept my small compact sony camera afloat when testing it out in the ocean. I don't understand why people were complaining of the strap breaking or falling off. It stayed in place hours in the water every day for a week on vacation.
customer_reviews.author: Brittney smittney

customer_reviews.title: Yes, it really does float!
customer_reviews.text: I took a leap of faith and chucked my Kodak waterproof camera into the lake with the Chums Float attached! The Chums Float was on the surface sticking up out of the water which makes it easier to grab then just laying flat on the surface like some camera floats. It also fits snuggly around larger hands and fits fine over smaller hands/wrists.
customer_reviews.author: Steph S

customer_reviews.title: Works great. I bought it with iPhone 6 waterproof case ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I bought it with iPhone 6 waterproof case as backup rescue tool and it did float and held my iPhone and the case. Also very comfortable to wear around my wrist, lightweight and doesn't occupy a lot of space. Did not test exactly how heavy it will hold. Hope that helps to someone.
customer_reviews.author: angela

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable and flimsy build
customer_reviews.text: It looks good, and held up my heavy flashlight with 8 AA batteries with no problem... That is, until the small cord came loose mid-dive and pulled out of the plastic clip, causing me to have to dive a good bit deeper to retrieve my light. While I was trying to reattached it, the plastic clip came loose and was lost. Definitely going to return and replace with one of the more reliable so-called "ugly" floats.
customer_reviews.author: M. Thornton

customer_reviews.title: a must buy
customer_reviews.text: No one should buy or use a waterproof camera in the sea or pool without this float. It is needed and a must. Then, one need not have to fear about dropping the camera and losing it. When we used our camera during snorkelling and swimming, the kids were "throwing" and passing the camera to one another and the float allowed them to do that without being afraid of losing it underwater. Great accessory for a waterproof camera. Great price as well.
customer_reviews.author: Rey

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use with the Pentax Optio WG-3 camera and it works great. When I first got it and felt the weight of the camera as compared to the float I thought "there is no way that will float this camera." I was wrong. It worked great. I tested it out at the Great Barrier Reef and it floated the camera up to the surface with no problem. Overall I am happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Localbuzz

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I Iove the product. It came in on time and didn’t disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb Costello

customer_reviews.title: Floats my DSC-TX20, but has a design flaw
customer_reviews.text: The strap floats my Sony DSC-TX20 very well, and is comfortable on the wrist. It also wraps nicely around my boat cleat for storage while swimming. The major flaw this unit has are the release tabs that hold the float to the lanyard. They come off very easily. To fix this I zip-tied through the eyelet of the connector and the lanyard. I doubt a zip-tie will break, but it looks tacky.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: great idea
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my pentax camera that I bring kayaking with me. If you drop your camera in the water it truly does float. the camera it self will be under the water but the big yellow float will be easy to see and easy to grab out of the water. The chum is big enough that I can put my hand through it and put it around my wrist too. I would recommend this if you have a waterproof camera that you use in the water and don't want to lose it.
customer_reviews.author: Amyleigh

customer_reviews.title: It passed the tug test
customer_reviews.text: After reading some reviews about this product coming apart, I was somewhat skeptical as I didn't want to risk losing my new Lumix waterproof camera. However, I didn't see any other floats that I liked as well. I was happy to see that this product is well put together. When the dog grabbed it and took off, we had a tug to get it away from her. It was fine after several good yanks on the little string that holds it to the camera. So I'm going to trust it. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Barb

customer_reviews.title: Broke in 30 seconds :(
customer_reviews.text: On opening up the box my initial reaction was of concern for the string attachment. Clearly the weakest point in the connection, this is exactly what snapped within :30 seconds. No serious strain or action. Thank god the camera was in my hand when I noticed it was no longer attached to the neoprene. I can't say I would suggest purchase. I'm in contact with the manufacturer about a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: strawberrytech

customer_reviews.title: Great Value, not as sturdy as I would want
customer_reviews.text: For the money, this is a great purchase. My one complaint is that the plastic that connects the buoyant part to the camera could be a little sturdier. It seems like it could potentially break and my camera would be lost in the deep. I see from some other reviews that this has happened to people. Overall I am pleased with this product and it has worked great for me so far.
customer_reviews.author: Dude12345

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Just came back from the Galapagos Islands where we used this with a Nikon AW-100 camera. I tested it first in a pool and it had enough bouyancy to keep the camera floating if dropped. It comfortably fit around the wrist. I don't see how the thin string can be broken so I'd suggest ignoring all messages saying that it could be a worry. Just get this item because it's perfect! I had researched many similar items and worried that everyone of them had alarming reviews but this is the real deal.
customer_reviews.author: David F. Wald

customer_reviews.title: Great for a smaller camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a great float and works well on a small Kodak video camera. I bought it to use with a larger Canon Powershot D20 and found that the camera was too heavy for the amount of flotation. That camera needs a bigger float. Wish there was a way to test before buying, or that the specs listed how many ounces could be supported.
customer_reviews.author: Laurence Marks

customer_reviews.title: light weight and doesn't feel like its in the way
customer_reviews.text: Very handy on our honeymoon snorkeling and passing the camera back and forth. light weight and doesn't feel like its in the way. very nice! The bright yellow is great for the water as well, you can find it easy! Super comfy.
customer_reviews.author: Janna

customer_reviews.title: unsatisfactory product
customer_reviews.text: The first time I attempted to use this product it failed. I was entering the water in mild surf with the strap attached to my camera and the float on my wrist and when I was several feet out from the shore an outgoing wave completely ripped the strap. Fortunately I was able to retrieve the camera from the sandy bottom. The lightweight cord connecting the camera to the float is extremely flimsy. I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Traveller

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This thing is fantastic. Keeps my camera on my wrist very securely, and in case it slips off it floats! Also a nice bright color so if you do happen to lose it it's easy to spot. The little tie loop part has a coupler you can attach/detach, which makes it easier to tie the loop on or detach/attach the camera at will. Could be used for more than just cameras too.
customer_reviews.author: Lars SveenTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Strap broke... lost camera in lake
customer_reviews.text: Bought a Panasonic underwater camera for our cruise to Mexico and bought this strap to go along with it. Took a bunch of pictures and when we got back, we went to a lake party but I did not get a chance to download the pictures off the camera before we went to the party. At the lake, I was floating around with the camera strapped to my wrist and next thing you know, the strap broke and the camera went to the bottom (around 25-30ft deep). Tried getting a diver out to look for it but was not able to. Lost all our cruise pictures along with the camera! Will not buy this strap again!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: This is awesome
customer_reviews.text: So the water cameras floated, so I was bummed I purchased this. Then, we went on a rafting trip and I was sooooo glad I had this to put around my arm. I essentially forgot I had the camera because I didn't have to worry about dropping it. Sure the camera's float, but they don't float near you in a river! I love this items. Even it's bright yellow color. It's awesome.
customer_reviews.author: A.T. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Better than nothing..
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this camera for our recent trip to Australia and New Zealand, knowing we were going to be doing some water activities and wanted to be able to capture the memories. Knowing that we would be out in the harbor there was a risk of dropping and loosing the waterproof camera. The Chum camera float prevented us from loosing this camera as we swam with the Hector Dolphins.
customer_reviews.author: Gramma P.

customer_reviews.title: It Floats
customer_reviews.text: Compared to other camera floats this one isn't super bulky yet keeps my camera afloat. I ordered this even though other reviews complained about the chord breaking, so far it hasn't but I don't take any chances and wrap my stock camera chord around the float as well. I've taken it to the beach, in the pool and on a snorkeling trip to Mexico, works great!
customer_reviews.author: Book Guy

customer_reviews.title: Worth it. May save your proof of the big one some day!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this float we are avid fisherman and boaters of all sorts and I know that this thing will keep my camera afloat. Bought one for all my cameras. Had one of these for 2 years now. Been through the ringer and back but just as good as the day I bought it. Not quite as bright of yellow anymore but hasn't tore, broke, sank or stretched since I've had it. Worth the money!!!
customer_reviews.author: countrysis

customer_reviews.title: Simple and useful
customer_reviews.text: This has a simple snap so the thick part / float can easily be removed but it won't come off by itself. Bright, comfortable etc. This isn't enough to float the camera but it will make it easy to find if you drop your camera in the water. I wouldn't consider bothering with a camera case as this float is way too big to fit in a case.
customer_reviews.author: Capt Dan

customer_reviews.title: Save Your Camera
customer_reviews.text: Being outdoorsy, keeping my new crushproof, waterproof, camera safe was a must. This guy works great. Easily detaches at a swivel point for those non-aquatic activities. Holds my camera easy in water and sticks brightly out of the water several inches so you can find it easily. Not a lot else to it except it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Buckner

customer_reviews.title: Floats like a charm
customer_reviews.text: This wrist floater worked great for our waterproof camera. We used it all over Hawaii around in the ocean while snorkling. The only complaint I would have is that the wrist strap is not adjustable, which means that it was a little loose on my small wrist and I had to be careful if I didn't want the camera to fall off.
customer_reviews.author: Mick McKeown

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase. I just used it for a week in the salt water and it works perfect, rinsed off after use with fresh water, still does not have an odor from the salt water. The only reason I did not give it five stars is that I realize that the seam where the loop is sewed together will eventually break. It could use a more solid sew job...
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Great for small cameras
customer_reviews.text: We haven't had any problems with the float. Do not rely on it for structural support - basically use another strap for carrying it around and just leave the float attached for emergency situations. The quick release buckle is not the strongest and I can see it falling off if you try to swim with it trailing behind you
customer_reviews.author: AmmeL

customer_reviews.title: Perfect way to secure your camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a great strap for water proof cameras. We use it at the water park and don't have to worry about losing the camera. I used it while snorkeling and while it floats enough to keep the camera up, it's not annoying to dive with it around your wrist.
customer_reviews.author: Alex W

customer_reviews.title: Essential for waterproof cameras
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the Nikon AW100 I purchased for my trip and it performed perfectly. I went diving with a helmet which meant the normal AW100 strap was useless to use but slipping this on my wrist made it easy to keep attached. I went snorkeling and it did float the camera really well. It's a must have investment to protect your waterproof cameras when in moving water.
customer_reviews.author: Greg V

customer_reviews.title: Enough float for a DSC-TX10
customer_reviews.text: It is a simple to use float w/ a nice quick release feature. That's a nice plus because it can be tough to thread a wrist strap through the loop on the Sony DSC-TX10. I've tested this out in a pool, and it floats w/ the loop popping out of the water. When I dropped the camera into the water w/ the loop, it stopped it after going about 1.5' deep & quickly popped back up to the surface.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Simply works
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised, was able to loop this and wear along with the strap that came with my canon D30 while diving. Performed a test where I released the camera with the strap and yes it floated!! Made me more comfortable while diving knowing it would work...but make sure you continue use of strap that comes with your camera to play it safe.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I had my phone in an expensive "Watershot Housing" case which between that and the weight of iPhone, was enough to sink all but the most buoyant of floats. This one saved me from having to make a deep dive. Even with rocky water and giant waves this thing stayed floating. Totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Pinky

customer_reviews.title: My new camera floatie
customer_reviews.text: It definitely keeps my point-and-shoot camera from sinking away into the abyss but I do have some concern about the latch mechanism. As a result, I also loop the camera wrist strap through the floatie so I have two points of attachment. That also makes it so I don't have the wrist strap getting in the way when I am using the floating strap.
customer_reviews.author: Scouter5446

customer_reviews.title: Works great - peace of mind...
customer_reviews.text: Works great - peace of mind... The clip and all make for quick removal - that could be a problem? However - I love the idea that I have safety and retention in mind for this expensive camera. Sure would hate to sink the camera with priceless photos in the river only to be discovered 20 years from now....
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended.
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly on our trip. Camera floated on top of the water, did as another reviewer suggested and ran the strap of the camera through the yellow part of the arm float. Didn't want to rely on the plastic twist clip to hold the camera. Size is just right so that it won't easily slip off your wrist, not so big that you have to push it up your arm to the elbow which would make taking pictures difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Minnie

customer_reviews.title: Worked for my GoPro
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my GoPro Hero3. I used it scuba diving and snorkeling while in the Cayman Islands. Worked great. I tested it in the ocean. It floated to the surface and bobbed up above the water about 4 inches. Made it easy to find. The loop was perfect for me. Very pleased with the purchase. Easily held the weight of the camera and waterproof housing.
customer_reviews.author: Linda C. Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: Great for my Olympus Tough 8.7 oz camera.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a life saver for paddle boarding with my waterproof camera which is an Olymus Tough which weighs 8.7 oz. I've knocked it off my board and dropped it out of my pocket and never worried. It is also comfortable to wear around the wrist. It's bulky but that's what makes it float so I have no problem with that.
customer_reviews.author: A. Waten

customer_reviews.title: You Need this!
customer_reviews.text: This works perfect, My Nikon floated perfectly in the water and you can also use it put the camera on if your in the sand which is nice. nice run on sentence... It detaches and attaches very nicely, only thing that I can see that it might need is a version with a superior cord to tie it with. I can see this breaking off sooner or later if your doing agro stuff. Maybe a metal wire stranded base for the cord...
customer_reviews.author: Nena

customer_reviews.title: Saved my Camera.
customer_reviews.text: This strip help me from losing my new water camera. It held up my camera at the surface of the water without issue. Even after a fish tried to take it down from the other strap. Only issue was the snug fit on my big wrist.
customer_reviews.author: JTRiker9

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job.  really Enjoy it
customer_reviews.text: I use it for a Olympus Tough 3000. Works good. It is just enough to float. The camera is in the water but you can see clearly the yellow strap. What I'm afraid of is that one day the thin cord that connects it to the camera will rip or the connect will break. And there goes the camera. But I've used it 3 times already and it's worked good.
customer_reviews.author: David Salazar

customer_reviews.title: STRAP BROKE ON FIRST USE
customer_reviews.text: This thing is worse than a cheap piece of junk! The strap broke as I was attaching it to the camera. I in no way was putting undue stress on the strap either. I was shocked when I saw it break off at the part where it connects to the float. It's too late to return it now, so I guess I just have to eat the $10. DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the camera floating and the yellow is visible under water.
customer_reviews.text: If anyone is going to be taking a phone or camera into the water (waterproof case), I highly recommend getting one of these floats! it fits good around the wrist without being loose or too tight and I let go to see if it would suspend or bring the camera back to the surface. It brought it back to the surface, but did take a few min (15ft depth).
customer_reviews.author: Gregory D. Stone

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: I used this with my Canon D30 underwater compact camera. I attached it to the opposite end of where the strap normally attaches to this camera, on the area where you left hand would rest if you are using the camera. Bottom line is that it is able to float the D20 with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: P. MSakamoto

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect
customer_reviews.text: I was a little concerned about some of the reviews on here about the strength of the strap but I can verify that it has been addressed and was strong on the one I got. We used it on Apache lake in AZ and floated it several times. I like how it has a quick release attachment too so it is easy to take off just the yellow part when your back on land.
customer_reviews.author: J. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Is it going to work?
customer_reviews.text: The float is much smaller than I expected and I am not sure that it will keep my iPhone and underwater enclosure afloat. What I am really concerned about is the size of the "string" that attaches the float to the camera. Who knows maybe it is made of some super strong fiber but it appears to be just a super skinny string. I would not purchase this again.
customer_reviews.author: W. Naritomi

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: Used this when on a vacation cruise. Made it easier to keep track of the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product, saved the camera in Costa Rica!
customer_reviews.text: Good thing my son had this when he was in the rough surf in Costa Rica. He got tossed around by a wave and had this on his wrist with his new waterproof camera and it saved the day. I am SO glad that I bought this before the trip and we will use it again anytime we are near the water.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Mom

customer_reviews.title: It floats
customer_reviews.text: The product floats our Panasonic TS20. It is bright and highly visible. It survived our week long beach vacation this summer, in both the freshwater pool and the Gulf of Mexico. We have also used it on our local lake when we take out the pontoon. Only reason for a 4/5 star is the quick release strap. I think it is a weak design and actually loop the camera strap around the float itself.
customer_reviews.author: OrvilleLee

customer_reviews.title: Fine for the price. Nice little BT speaker
customer_reviews.text: For the price it is quite good. Sound is good when playing iTunes or any other music app on my phone. The speaker paiured to my phone easily. Seems to have pretty good range with Bluetooth. Overall a good buy. The speaker doesn't get way loud so it sounds good even at max volume.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, should make for more things
customer_reviews.text: Got this after I bought my waterproof camera. Never actually got to use it but seemed like it would work well. Great idea. Maybe will use it for waterproof phone. Or as a beer float or in the pool.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: So glad I did
customer_reviews.text: Got this with a waterproof enclosure. So glad I did. It worked for my light digital camera. The bright strap is nice also. It is bulky but the long cord helps. I thought the cord was to flimsy but I used it several times in ocean no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Rum Junkie

customer_reviews.title: what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased a rather pricey waterproof camera for my son who fishes a lot and has dropped his camera and cell phones in the water many times. I wanted something that he could attach to the camera just in case (I should say, 'when') he drops it that would keep it afloat. This does the job beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: ChaskaLady

customer_reviews.title: Fits all wrist sizes
customer_reviews.text: This kept my waterproof camera afloat and stayed on my wrists while snorkeling. It stayed on my tiny wrists, even though it's large enough for bigger folks. I saw some negative comments about how it holds water, but I'm not sure how this is a problem while you're IN the water. It was not at all uncomfortable!
customer_reviews.author: razzledazzleme

product_meta.title: Chums Waterproof Camera Float
product_meta.description:
This gorgeous Chums waterproof camera float has the finest details and highest quality you will find anywhere! Chums waterproof camera float is truly remarkable. Product details: • condition: brand new • item SKU: ss-sms-4003017 • information: Chums waterproof camera float is a high-density foam floater that easily attaches to most waterproof cameras and accessories. The soft, foam-filled neoprene wrist lanyard easily attaches to most lightweight, point and shoot, waterproof cameras. Bight yellow strap makes it easy to spot your fallen goods. Floats 200 grams/7oz. Very important: test your own camera in shallow water before use! our floater may not float your specific camera and battery.

AMAZON.COM
Save your new digital camera from going to the bottom of the lake, river, or ocean. The soft, foam-filled neoprene wrist lanyard easily attaches to most lightweight, point & shoot, waterproof cameras and accessories. The bright yellow color makes it easy to spot in the water. Not intended for use with large professional underwater cameras, or regular/non-waterproof cameras.
feature_bullets: Camera float for waterproof cameras (camera not included)
Maximum float weight for our camera float is 7 ounces
Soft, foam-filled neoprene wrist lanyard easily attaches to most lightweight, point & shoot, waterproof cameras
Bright yellow color makes it easy to spot in the water
Not intended for use with large professional underwater cameras, or regular/non waterproof cameras

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars902 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
specifications.Best Sellers Rank: #397 in Underwater Photography Products#2,810 in Camera Bags & Cases
